components.description:
An adult with no gender specified. This emoji may be used to talk about adults in a gender-inclusive way.

Variants include üë© Woman and üë® Man.
components.title: Person

components.description:
Zero Width Joiner (ZWJ) is a Unicode character that joins two or more other characters together in sequence to create a new emoji.

Zero Width Joiner, pronounced "zwidge", is not an emoji and has no appearance by itself. This is an invisible character when used alone.

View Emoji ZWJ Sequences that use this character.
components.title: Zero Width Joiner

components.description:
A rice plant, as grown before harvesting and processing. Depicted as a sheaf of Asian rice with green leaves and yellow seed heads drooping over to the right or left. Sometimes assumed to be wheat.

May be used to represent a variety of cereal grains (e.g., wheat, corn, oats, sorghum) as well as crops, fields and harvests, and farming more generally.

This emoji is occassionally used in the place of the word 'white' as in, a white skin tone. This form of Voldemorting is potentially due to the similarity of the words 'white' and 'wheat', and used in online discussions where it is undesirable to have the actual word written out.
components.title: Ear of Rice

description: A person engaged in agriculture, raising living organisms for food or raw materials. Generally depicted as wearing a wide-brimmed hat and holding a crop (such as carrots or corn) or a pitchfork.
title: Farmer
apple_vendor_description: The farmer emoji on Apple devices presents a cheerful individual clad in practical attire, complete with a straw hat that casts a gentle shadow. Apple‚Äôs signature glossy 3D shading brings out the texture of their clothing and the healthy glow on their face, suggesting diligence and a connection to the earth. This emoji is perfect for conveying a sense of hard work, rural life, or the bounty of nature in your digital conversations.
